summary: crimean-Congo hemorrhagic fever virus (CCHFV) is a tick-borne virus that causes severe hemorrhagic fever with a mortality rate of 30% in more than 30 countries worldwide (1–4) there is no vaccine against CCHFV, and therapeutic interventions are limited. the increased tick vector population could be associated with climate change (7). hantavirus nucleocapsid protein (N protein) binds to the mRNA 5′ cap and ribosomal protein S19. eIF4F complex engages the 43S preinitiation ribosome complex at the mRNA 5′ cap.
